suncertify.server.gui

Class BrokerAppServerGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.server.gui.BrokerAppServerGUI

  • public class BrokerAppServerGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The BrokerAppServerGUI class implements the GUI interface for the remote application server in the contractor broker application. This is the GUI that is displayed when the application run mode is "server only".
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BrokerAppServerGUI.AppServerAction
      The AppServerAction class implements the action for the three buttons and menu items in the APP server GUI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerAppServerGUI

        public BrokerAppServerGUI()
                   throws BrokerServerException
        The BrokerAppServerGUI constructs the components constituting the application server main GUI and makes the GUI visible at the end.
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - is thrown if there were errors in contructing the GUI. A possibility is when there were issues with the application configuration file.
        See Also:
        addMenuBar(), addConfigOptionsPanel(), addStatusPanel(), addCommandOptionsPanel()

    • Method Detail

      • addMenuBar

        private void addMenuBar()
        This method adds the menubar to the APP server main GUI.

      • addConfigOptionsPanel

        private void addConfigOptionsPanel()
        This method adds the configuration options panel to the APP server main GUI.
        See Also:
        AppConfigOptionsPanel

      • addCommandOptionsPanel

        private void addCommandOptionsPanel()
        This method adds the command options panel to the APP server main GUI. This panel is made up of the "Start Server", "Stop Server" and "Exit" buttons.

      • addStatusPanel

        private void addStatusPanel()
        This method adds the status panel to the application server GUI. The panel displays the status of the server and instructions on what actions could be taken based on the current status of the server.
